mn1:1.2: At one time the Buddha was staying near Ukkaṭṭhā, in the Subhaga Forest at the root of a magnificent sal tree.
mn1:1.3: There the Buddha addressed the bhikkhus,
mn1:2.1: “Bhikkhus, I will teach you the explanation of the root of all phenomena.
mn1:2.2: Listen and apply your minds well, I will speak.”
mn1:3.1: “Take an unlearned ordinary person who has not seen the noble ones, and is neither skilled nor trained in the teaching of the noble ones. They’ve not seen true persons, and are neither skilled nor trained in the teaching of the true persons.
mn1:3.3: Having perceived beings as beings, they conceive beings …
mn1:3.5: Because they haven’t fully understood it, I say.
mn1:4.2: Having perceived water as water, they conceive water …
mn1:4.4: Because they haven’t fully understood it, I say.
mn1:5.2: Having perceived fire as fire, they conceive fire …
mn1:5.4: Because they haven’t fully understood it, I say.
mn1:6.2: Having perceived air as air, they conceive air …
mn1:6.4: Because they haven’t fully understood it, I say.
mn1:7.2: Having perceived beings as beings, they conceive beings …
mn1:7.4: Because they haven’t fully understood it, I say.
mn1:8.2: Having perceived gods as gods, they conceive gods …
mn1:8.4: Because they haven’t fully understood it, I say.

mn1:9.2: Having perceived the Progenitor as the Progenitor, they conceive the Progenitor …
mn1:9.4: Because they haven’t fully understood it, I say.
mn1:10.2: Having perceived Brahmā as Brahmā, they conceive Brahmā …
mn1:10.4: Because they haven’t fully understood it, I say.

mn1:11.2: Having perceived those of streaming radiance as those of streaming radiance, they conceive those of streaming radiance …
mn1:11.4: Because they haven’t fully understood it, I say.
mn1:12.1: They perceive those replete with glory as those replete with glory.
mn1:12.2: Having perceived those replete with glory as those replete with glory, they conceive those replete with glory …
mn1:12.4: Because they haven’t fully understood it, I say.
mn1:13.1: They perceive those of abundant fruit as those of abundant fruit.
mn1:13.2: Having perceived those of abundant fruit as those of abundant fruit, they conceive those of abundant fruit …
mn1:13.4: Because they haven’t fully understood it, I say.
mn1:14.1: They perceive the Conqueror as the Conqueror.
mn1:14.2: Having perceived the Conqueror as the Conqueror, they conceive the Conqueror …
mn1:14.4: Because they haven’t fully understood it, I say.
mn1:15.1: They perceive the field of infinite space as the field of infinite space.
mn1:15.2: Having perceived the field of infinite space as the field of infinite space, they conceive the field of infinite space …
mn1:15.4: Because they haven’t fully understood it, I say.

mn1:16.2: Having perceived the field of infinite consciousness as the field of infinite consciousness, they conceive the field of infinite consciousness …
mn1:16.4: Because they haven’t fully understood it, I say.

mn1:17.2: Having perceived the field of nothingness as the field of nothingness, they conceive the field of nothingness …
mn1:17.4: Because they haven’t fully understood it, I say.
mn1:18.1: They perceive the field of neither perception nor non-perception as the field of neither perception nor non-perception.
mn1:18.2: Having perceived the field of neither perception nor non-perception as the field of neither perception nor non-perception, they conceive the field of neither perception nor non-perception …
mn1:18.4: Because they haven’t fully understood it, I say.
mn1:19.1: They perceive the seen as the seen.
mn1:19.2: Having perceived the seen as the seen, they conceive the seen …
mn1:19.4: Because they haven’t fully understood it, I say.

mn1:20.4: Because they haven’t fully understood it, I say.

mn1:21.4: Because they haven’t fully understood it, I say.

mn1:22.2: Having perceived the known as the known, they conceive the known …
mn1:22.4: Because they haven’t fully understood it, I say.
mn1:23.2: Having perceived oneness as oneness, they conceive oneness …
mn1:23.4: Because they haven’t fully understood it, I say.
mn1:24.2: Having perceived diversity as diversity, they conceive diversity …
mn1:24.4: Because they haven’t fully understood it, I say.
mn1:25.1: They perceive the All as the All.
mn1:25.2: Having perceived the All as the All, they conceive the All …
mn1:25.4: Because they haven’t fully understood it, I say.
mn1:26.2: Having perceived Nibbāna as Nibbāna, they conceive Nibbāna, they conceive in Nibbāna, they conceive apart from Nibbāna, they conceive ‘Nibbāna is mine’, they delight in Nibbāna.
mn1:26.4: Because they haven’t fully understood it, I say.
mn1:27.1: A bhikkhu who is a trainee, who hasn’t achieved his goal, but lives aspiring to the supreme safety from the yoke, comprehends earth as earth.
mn1:27.2: Having comprehended earth as earth, let him not conceive earth, let him not conceive in earth, let him not conceive apart from earth, let him not conceive ‘earth is mine’, let him not delight in earth.
mn1:27.4: So that he may completely understand it, I say.

mn1:51.1: A bhikkhu who is an Arahant—with influxes destroyed, who has fulfilled [the training], done what had to be done, laid down the burden, achieved the highest goal, utterly destroyed the fetter of being, and is liberated through the right, ultimate knowledge—comprehends earth as earth.
mn1:51.2: Having comprehended earth as earth, he does not conceive earth, he does not conceive in earth, he does not conceive apart from earth, he does not conceive ‘earth is mine’, he does not delight in earth.
mn1:51.4: Because he has fully understood it, I say.

mn1:147.1: The Realized One, the Arahant, the fully awakened Buddha comprehends earth as earth.
mn1:147.2: Having comprehended earth as earth, he does not conceive earth, he does not conceive in earth, he does not conceive apart from earth, he does not conceive ‘earth is mine’, he does not delight in earth.
mn1:147.4: Because the Realized One has fully understood it to the end, I say.

mn1:171.1: The Realized One, the Arahant, the fully awakened Buddha comprehends earth as earth.
mn1:171.2: Having comprehended earth as earth, he does not conceive earth, he does not conceive in earth, he does not conceive apart from earth, he does not conceive ‘earth is mine’, he does not delight in earth.
mn1:171.4: Because he has understood that delight is the root of suffering,
mn1:171.5: and that with being there is birth; whatever exists gets old and dies.
mn1:171.6: That’s why the Realized One—with the ending, fading away, cessation, giving up, and letting go of all cravings—has awakened to the supreme perfect Awakening, I say.
